intro: Orychophragmus taibaiensis, commonly known as the Taibai bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and upright. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
